description: This creamy white bean chili is the perfect light and fresh alternative to a classic bean chili.
ingredients: [{"name": "olive oil", "units": "tablespoon", "amount": 2}, {"name": "white onion", "units": "diced", "amount": 1}, {"name": "celery", "units": "sticks, diced", "amount": 2}, {"name": "green bell pepper", "units": "diced", "amount": 1}, {"name": "garlic", "units": "cloves, minced", "amount": 3}, {"name": "cannellini beans", "units": "400g tinned, drained and rinsed", "amount": 2}, {"name": "vegetable stock", "units": "ml", "amount": 500}, {"name": "lime", "units": "juiced and zest", "amount": 1}, {"name": "cilantro", "units": "g, diced", "amount": 20}, {"name": "sweetcorn", "units": "g", "amount": 50}, {"name": "pickled jalapeños", "units": "slices, diced", "amount": 6}, {"name": "oregano", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": 1}, {"name": "cornflour", "units": "tablespoon", "amount": 1}, {"name": "cumin", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": 1}, {"name": "coriander powder", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": 0.5}, {"name": "chili powder", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": 0.5}, {"name": "cream cheese", "units": "tablespoon, softened", "amount": 2}]
instructions: Heat the oil in a pan, then add the diced onion, green pepper, and celery. Sauté for 5-8 minutes until they’ve softened, stirring often. Add the garlic cloves, and cook for another minute or two. Add the cornflour and seasonings and cook for another 2-3 minutes, stirring the flour into the vegetables. Add the diced jalapeno, vegetable stock, sweetcorn, and white beans and stir together. Leave to simmer for 10 - 15 minutes. Stir in the cream cheese and diced cilantro, then squeeze over the lime juice before serving. Taste and adjust seasonings (add more salt if needed). Top with feta cheese, a wedge of lime, sliced avocado, more diced cilantro, jalapeños, and tortilla chips to scoop up the chili!
notes: If the chili feels too thick, add a splash more stock or water. Crushing some of the beans gives you a naturally creamy texture without blending. This chili tastes even better after sitting for 20–30 minutes - the flavors really settle and taste even more delicious. Store leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 4 days. This chili freezes well for up to 3 months.
